pairs.description: ACE inhibitors may enhance hypoglycemic effect of antidiabetic agents. Monitor blood glucose closely.
pairs.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose; adjust metformin dose if needed

pairs.description: Concurrent use may cause excessive hypotension, especially on initiation. Loop diuretics may enhance nephrotoxic effect of ACE inhibitors in patients with volume depletion.
pairs.recommendation: Monitor BP and renal function closely. Ensure adequate hydration.

pairs.description: Loop diuretics may increase metformin exposure and decrease renal function, increasing risk of lactic acidosis.
pairs.recommendation: Monitor renal function (eGFR) regularly; hold metformin if eGFR <30

pairs.description: No significant interaction, but both affect glucose metabolism.
Risk of serotonin syndrome when triptans combined with SSRIs. Symptoms include agitation, confusion, rapid heart rate, high blood pressure.
pairs.recommendation: Use caution. Educate patient on serotonin syndrome symptoms. Consider alternative migraine treatment.

pairs.description: No known interaction. Both used for asthma control.
